page.title: 12Ecology of Braydon 2
page.content: Sadly many of the ponds in the fields have been filled in, but there is one which has been cleared out by the Wiltshire Trust for Conservation in 1982 and now provides homes for frogs, newts and other water loving creatures. There is a small lake with a stream running from it, both of which are polluted by silage effluent, there are wild duck nesting around the lake. There are many footpaths and bridleways in this section the total length being about 43km not all are in regular use. The hedges have been largely left intact and at least one farmer practises organic farming which is allowing many of the grasses and flowers to flourish here.
